function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Lack of focus on infectious diseases in architecture and urban design education and practice.","Impact":"Increased risk of spreading contagious diseases in the built environment.","Mitigation":"Integrating infectious disease education and practice into architecture and urban design curriculum and guidelines.","Technologies":"Air filtration systems, antimicrobial materials, and smart building technologies.","People":"Architects, urban planners, and public health officials.","Owner":"Government health departments and professional organizations."},{"Description":"New normal of social distancing and virtual engagement leading to living and working in confined spaces.","Impact":"Increased mental and physical health risks due to prolonged confinement and isolation.","Mitigation":"Promoting mental health support services, creating green and open spaces within urban environments, and encouraging sustainable urban design.","Technologies":"Virtual communication technologies, urban green space planning tools, and sustainable building materials.","People":"Urban residents, remote workers, and mental health professionals.","Owner":"City councils, urban planners, and mental health organizations."},{"Description":"Foretelling of the new normal in architectural and urban theory literature.","Impact":"Potential lack of preparedness for the consequences of the new normal on public health and well-being.","Mitigation":"Strengthening interdisciplinary research and collaboration between architecture, urban planning, and public health professionals.","Technologies":"Digital collaboration platforms, interdisciplinary research networks, and data analytics tools.","People":"Researchers, educators, and practitioners in architecture, urban planning, and public health.","Owner":"Academic institutions, research organizations, and government agencies."}]}
